trans-unit.source: Represents the `<saml:AuthzDecisionStatement>` element defined by SAML 2.0.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2SecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify whether a subject is authorized to access a specific resource.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML 2.0 specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> class.

When specified in a SAML 2.0 assertion in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Assertion.Statements%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> asserts an authorization decision regarding access by the subject of the assertion to a specified resource.
The subject of the SAML 2.0 assertion is specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Assertion.Subject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The following table summarizes the properties that are associated with the authorization decision.
Property
Description
The authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to the resource represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property.
A set of SAML assertions that the SAML authority relied on to render the decision.
A URI reference that identifies the resource to which access is sought.
The set of actions that the subject is authorized to perform on the resource represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property.
Each action is represented by an instance of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Action>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> class with the specified decision for the specified resource.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Actions%2A> property is initialized to null in the new instance.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the resource about which the authorization decision applies.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision"></xref> value that indicates the decision.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Decision"></xref> property.
resource is `null`.
resource is not an absolute URI or an empty relative URI.
decision is not a valid value.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement"></xref> class with the specified decision for the specified actions on the specified resource.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the resource about which the authorization decision applies.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision"></xref> value that indicates the decision.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Decision"></xref> property.
A collection of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Action"></xref> that specifies the actions to be authorized on the resource.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Actions"></xref> property.
resource is `null`.
resource is not an absolute URI or an empty relative URI.
decision is not a valid value.
Gets or sets the set of actions authorized to be performed on the specified resource.
Corresponds to the `<saml:Actions>` child element.
A collection of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Action"></xref> that specifies the authorized actions.
Gets or sets the decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to the specified resource.
Corresponds to the `<saml:Decision>` child element.

One of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision"></xref> values that specify the authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority with respect to access by the subject to the specified resource.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAccessDecision"></xref> value occurs.
Gets an empty URI reference.
The reference may be used to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource"></xref> property.
When used, it specifies the start of the current document.
An empty URI reference.
Gets or sets the set of assertions that the SAML authority relied on in making the decision.
[Saml2Core, 2.7.4]
Corresponds to the `<saml:Evidence>` child element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2Evidence"></xref> that contains the assertions.
Gets or sets the URI reference that identifies the resource to which access authorization is sought.
Corresponds to the `Resource` attribute [!INCLUDE[wif_saml2_ref](~/includes/wif-saml2-ref-md.md)].

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.Resource%2A> property may be set to an absolute URI or to the empty URI reference (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2AuthorizationDecisionStatement.EmptyResource>).
When it is set to the empty URI reference, the meaning is defined to be the start of the current document.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that identifies the resource.
An attempt to set a value that is `null` occurs.
An attempt to set a value that is not an absolute URI or is not an empty relative URI occurs.
